metadata.subject: I don't know if they'll publish this:

relationships.description: Krassner opened for Corey's show and shared personal conversations backstage
Corey presented gifts to Castro during a diplomatic mission to Cuba

analysis.purpose: To share personal anecdotes about Irwin Corey and potentially submit content for publication
analysis.significance: Provides personal insights into comedian Irwin Corey's character and controversial statements

notable_quotes: "He revealed his dark side in a room backstage, where we smoked a joint, and he told me how he used to read Nazi hate literature to get him in the mood to perform."
"The night before he died, he said to a close friend, James Drougas, 'Trump will be assassinated soon.'"

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present in the document

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - only personal anecdotes and reminiscences

details: Reference to Los Angeles Times obituary
Mention of Krassner's magazine The Realist

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be personal correspondence sharing anecdotes about a public figure (comedian Irwin Corey) that could be of interest to media outlets

analysis.summary: Paul Krassner shares personal anecdotes about comedian Irwin Corey, including his backstage revelation about reading Nazi literature to get in performance mood, his deathbed prediction about Trump's assassination, and his humanitarian mission to Cuba where he met Fidel Castro.
